description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

v1.0.description:
Compatible with Manual Stable 20241119.

This manual contains the following:

- Option to play from either a fresh save file or a completed one. Notated as "Linear" and "Open" in the YAML, respectively.
- 6 difficulty combinations
- 54 story levels (18 per difficulty option), each to be sent before it can be played. (Aztec and Egyptian currently unavailable in either mode)
- 183 mission objectives among all 3 difficulties
- 69 key locations (23 per difficulty)
- 42 intel locations (14 per difficulty)
- 18 target times/cheat unlocks

**IMPORTANT:** If you opt to play a solo linear run, you will need to enable objectives and keys+intel due to there being more items than locations otherwise. This limitation is removed if generated in a multiworld with adequate filler items.
v1.0.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.0

v1.1.0.description:
"Open" gameplay now starts you with a random starting stage per difficulty set.

Minor logic fixes in goal conditions.
v1.1.0.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.1.0

v1.1.1.description: Logic updated to no longer force "Facility" to be placed on completing "Dam" in any difficulty for solo generations.
v1.1.1.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.1.1

v1.2.0.description:
Updated APWorld to be compatible with Stable - 20250714

# APWorld Updates:

- Setting game mode to "Linear" no longer starts with an additional level unlocked. This was caused by an incorrect formatting with starting items.
- Yaml options adjusted to be more legible and updated to adapt weights instead of only True/False.
v1.2.0.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.2.0

v1.3.0.description:
APWorld updated to be compatible with AP 0.6.3 and Manual 20250813.

- Region logic reworked to properly connect to each other.
- - Each difficulty is now in its own region to help with solo generations.

- Location names updated to provide clarity to which level they are in

- Objectives are now sorted by their respective levels in the client.

- Removed weapon/gadget requirements in select stages (i.e. "Watch Laser" for "Train", or "AR33" for "Jungle"). These are now classified as `useful`.
v1.3.0.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.3.0

v1.3.1.description: Corrected logic in Surface 1 requiring `Comms Room Key` on additional locations.
v1.3.1.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.3.1

v1.3.2.description:
Updated and unified YAML options. All options, with exception to cheat unlocks, are now all-inclusive to their relative difficulty.

- Cheats are now a single true/false option.
- "Linear" and "Open" logic is now determined by "Linear_Gameplay" being set to either true/false.
v1.3.2.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.3.2

v1.4.0.description:
- Added Aztec and Egyptian levels as additional locations for open world players.
- Reconfigured items and yaml options to exclude items not required on Agent or Secret Agent difficulty.
- Mission options in yaml now include objectives by default. This allows for a minimal gameplay experience with linear and Agent-only.
- Generation will now exclude locations for options on difficulties not part of the enabled "Mission" option(s).
- - For example, if playing with only Secret Agent missions and the option for Agent keys are left on `True`, those key locations will not be registered by the generator since `Agent_Missions` is left on `False`.
- - Additionally, if `Include_Aztec` or `Include_Egyptian` is left on `True` as well as `Linear_Gameplay` being `True`, they will not be included in generation.
v1.4.0.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.4.0

v1.4.1.description:
- Corrected logic errors from Aztec and Egyptian additions.
- Added helper hook function to remove unneeded progression items from pool if only `Agent_Missions` is enabled.
- Reduced location and region bloat with rules hook.
- Swapped `Timed Mines` for `Tank` in `Runway - Secret Agent` and `Runway - Double Agent` requirements.

Huge thanks to Nicopopxd for assistance setting up the hook functions!
v1.4.1.title: Goldeneye007 (N64) Manual APWorld v1.4.1
